Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2009 04:50PM dietcoke wrote: I had Mammosite in March.  It was ok as far as radiation goes.  Be sure they put you on an antiobiotic that last the entire time the balloon was in.  If you have any questions, I can tell you what my experience was like.  I had DCIS.
Posts.Title: MammoSite 5 day treatment LifeAndQualityOfLife Everlastpink

Posts.Content: dietcoke wrote: I had mammosite radiation 4 years ago.  Check ups have been uneventful, thank God.  Now suddenly the breast is very sore.  How can that be? Ann Dx 1/19/2009, DCIS, Stage 0, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 4 years out from mammosite dietcoke Triciaski

Posts.Content: dietcoke wrote: Since I had radiation in March my blood sugar numbers are continuing to climb.  Could there be any connection to the radiation affecting my blood sugar?  My fasting blood sugar numbers are higher than they have ever been.  Anyone have any experience with that. Posts.Title: Radiation and diabetes dietcoke hollyberry

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2010 04:37AM dietcoke wrote: Sheila, my mammogram was a diagnostic mammogram.  Sometime between the time I completed radiation and my first followup mammogram my surgeons office started doing mammograms.  I thought well I will just have it done there.  The problem with that is that there isn't a radiologist there all the time to read them.  So the waiting game persist even though it was a diagnostic mammogram.  I'm considering switching back to the hospital for my mammograms just for that reason.    Ann
